1.content: You're a character on a TV Show(probably a male, but who knows...). Now then, which show are you on?
1.title: Casting Call

11.content:
The Town of Sunnydale, California has it all- Sun, Fun, Hot Chicks, Handsome Guys and the occasional Vampire or Demon from Hell. But this is the way of things when you live on a Hellmouth.

In a basement somewhere in town, three geniuses gather around a table, as Warren Mears unveils his newest genius weapon.

"Okay, Guys...this is what we've been waiting for." Warren said, looking over the faces of Andrew and Jonothan.

"They're releasing Doctor Who on DVD?" Jonothan asked.

"That'd be so awesome." Andrew said.

"And they should also get around to releasing Star Trek:Voyager, too." Jonothan said.

"Guys," Warren interrupted, "It's not that. No, it's much better. Watch this." With that, Warren turned and pointed the science fiction looking gun, a long heavy looking machine which he held with both hands, at a chair across the room. A ray of blue light surrounded the chair and it quickly shrink away to a tiny size. Jonothan and Andrew ran to examine the chair and laughed.

"That's awesome! Like "Land of the Giants" awesome." Andrew said. Jonothon stared at the chair, open mouthed.

"This is amazing."

"All in a days work in the life of a Q from both Bond and Star Trek." Warren said, grinning and nodding.

"So what are we going to do with it?" Jonothan asked.

"Same thing to try to do every day, Pinky. Try and take over the world!" Warren said with an evil grin.
................

It was a relativly slow day and the Magic Box closed early. Now it was empty save for...(insert who you want to be and who will be shrunk here...)
11.title: Buffy:The Shrinkee Slayer?

111.content:
Buffy sighed, bored that she was there alone.
The bell rang as jonothan, andrew & warren entered, warren was holding the shrink gun.
"What do you geeks want?", buffy said.
Warren laughed, "YOU!"
He pointed the gun at buffy & fired.
111.title: Hi & bye buffy

choices: Buffy dives out & escapes to cover
1111.content:
Buffy screamed as she shrank to 6 inches, she didn't have time to compose herself as the 3 boys faces glared down at her.
Suddenly warrens hand shot down & scooped her up.
"Just what i always wanted the slayer in the palm of my hand". He boomed as buffy squirmed in his grip.
"LET ME GO!" She screamed.
Warren put her in a small box, as all 3 left the store to go back to warrens for some fun.
When they reach warrens he opens the box and......
1111.title: Buffy in hand

11111.content:
Buffy launches out of the box on the floor & runs underneath a giant bolted down table.
The boys all try in vain to reach her, but they can't.
"Ah, screw her, lets go & find some other babes". Said jonothan.
The boys agree & buffy hears them leave.
She suddenly realises she has her cell phone & it works!
Who does she call?
11111.title: Cant reach

111111.content:
Buffy dials Willow's number, but after a couple of rings, loses the signal. The circuitry in the phone is just too small to be effective anymore. No big deal, though. Buffy has faced off against apocalypse after apocalypse. One giant world should be manageable.

She notices a window that's cracked open, and fortunately, plenty of wires and gadgets are all around to provide plenty of climbing opportunities.

Using her slayer speed and agility, she launches herself up the wires and soon makes her way to the windowsill, where she of course trips a booby-trap.
111111.title: Tiny cell phone doesn't work

111112.content:
Buffy calls dawn & explains everything, & dawn says she will be right over.
A while buffy hears dawn entering, "buffy, where are you?", she whispers. buffy starts edging out.
Suddenly warren bursts in an in a flash shrinks dawn to 1 inch.
Dawn stands sill payalysed with fear.
warren says "ok slayer come out, or else!".
Buffy tries to move but she can't because of fear.
"FINE!" warren says.
He then...
111112.title: Little dawn

1112.content:
The nerds watch, a little too excitedly, as Buffy dwindles down to a mere one inch in height. Now, if this was any other suddenly shrunken girl, she would be too shocked to make a move, but this is Buffy here. After taking a split-second to realize how small she's become, she runs off, so fast the nerds can't keep track of which where she's going.

Buffy hides behind a bookcase, as the three geeks search around for her. After a while, they give up, realizing that she probably won't last very long at her size anyway.

Once they leave, Buffy emerges from behind the bookcase and stares up at the gigantic Magic Shop.

"When I get big again, I am so going to kick their--"

She suddenly notices someone entering through the front door.
1112.title: Quick Little Buffy

11121.content:
Anya enters, and from Buffy's point of view, she now seems huge.

"Anya!" Buffy yells, trying to get her attention, as she runs over to Anya's feet. She tries jumping up and down, waving her arms frantically, but nothing seems to work. Buffy's just too damn tiny to be heard.

Just then, Anya accidentally knocks a pencil off of the counter. As she begins to bend down to pick it up, she catches sight of Buffy...perhaps...
11121.title: Enter Anya

111212.content: Oh my gosh a bug Anya yelled. She moved he foot and tried to squash Buffy. Wait Anya it just me she yelled. But it was no use, Anya couldn't here her. So Buffy ran for it and took cover behind the bookshelf. That was close. Damn, this sucks, how am I suppose to get anywhere with out being squashed. The another person entered.
111212.title: Almost squashed like a bug

choices: Willow discovers Buffy in her shoe
Buffy escapes the shoe before she's squished
1112121.content:
"Hey Anya" said Willow. "How's the world of retail?"

Anya made a face. "Unfortunately, our customers might be run off by icky bugs. I'm going to have to call an exterminator."

Behind the bookshelf, tiny Buffy reacted with disgust, then fright. "Icky? Exterminator?!! I've got to get Willow's attention!" She ran towards Willow's shoelace, but was spotted by Anya.

"There it is again!" Anya stomped her high-heeled shoe down, narrowly missing the insect-sized slayer. Buffy managed to leap up to the rim of Willow's shoe, and slipped inside.

"Yuck, it's in my shoe!" said Willow.
1112121.title: Willow's shoe

11121211.content:
As she fell inside the darkness of Willow's shoe, Buffy grasped for a handhold to steady herself. Unfortunately, Willow lifted her foot, causing the teeny slayer to tumble uncontrollably towards the young witches' toes. Buffy slammed against the front of Willow's shoe and could feel the pressure of her toes against her body. "Is this how it ends?" She thought. "I've saved the world multiple times, survived endless apocalypses, and already died twice, and now this? Squashed like a bug under my best friend's toes? What a humiliating way to go!"

Willow undid her shoelace and started to remove her shoe. "Are you sure that was a bug, Anya? I didn't get a real good look, but I could swear it only had two legs. And maybe it's the latte talkin', but I think I saw blonde hair!"

Anya shrugged her shoulders. "I don't care if it had amber highlights, it was tiny and icky and you should kill it!"

The tremendous pressure on her was relieved, but before Buffy could take advantage of it, bright light burst into the shoe, nearly blinding her. Just as she started to make out the shape of Willow's enormous face hovering above, "Will, it's me! I--" Suddenly, her miniature world was turned upside-down. She found herself rocketing back through the length of the shoe and falling through space, finally landing in what felt like a gym mat.

Willow and Anya stared in shock at the minute creature in Willow's hand. "B-B-Buffy? Is that you? What happened?"

Buffy quickly shouted the story of Warren and the shrink ray and her troubles since.

"I'm sorry my toes almost squished you." said Willow, looking down at her tiny friend apologetically. "Yes, and I'm sorry I called you icky and tried to step on you...several times." said Anya. "To be fair, you are very tiny, though." Buffy glared at her.
11121211.title: There's a Slayer in my Shoe

choices: Anya, Xander, and Dawn run into Warren
111212112.content:
Willow carried the shrunken slayer over to the table and gently set her down. She and Anya sat and lowered their heads to the table level. "Are you okay Buffy? Aside from being all shrunk and everything, I mean?"

"Good as you can be at an inch tall, I guess," she replied. "I'm just worried about the damage that Warren might be doing with that shrink ray. I don't think he's gonna stop with shrinking me. You guys have any ideas to get him?"

"I have an idea!" said Anya excitedly. "Of course, it involves selling tickets to see Buffy fight fleas, so..." Willow cut her off. "Anya! This is serious! A big bad could strike at any time and right now we have a very little slayer who couldn't hurt a fly! Literally! Umm...sorry, Buff. I mean, you probably could take a fly. Maybe even a bee. Or a...grasshopper...I'm not helping, am I?" She looked down at her tiny friend with a sheepish look on her face, afraid of humiliating her further. Buffy sat down, feeling even smaller.

Anya pondered for a minute. "I don't know, grasshoppers can be pretty tough customers..." Buffy walked over and kicked Anya's finger. The former vengeance demon didn't even notice. "...now, a cricket on the other hand, I could see Buffy taking down..." The slayer walked back to the center of the table and collaped in defeat.

Willow suddenly sprang up. "Alright, we can't just wait around for Warren to come back and shrink the rest of us. Here's what we're gonna do. Anya, you go get Xander and Dawn and check out where the Trio were hiding out before. I know of a spell that could possible restore Buffy."

"But you gave up magic. You were 'addicted', remember?" said Anya, sarcastically.

"That's why, I'm calling Tara first. If I don't have to do it on my own, it won't corrupt me. Plus we can keep an eye out for Warren. Now get going!"

"Alright! Alright!" Anya leaned her huge face close to the teeny slayer. "Buffy, could you do me an itty-bitty favor while I'm gone, and check to make sure all the mouse-holes in the basement are sealed? Thanks!" She patted her on the head with her pinky, knocking Buffy on her face.

"Anya, get out of here!" yelled Willow. As Anya exited the shop, Willow scooped Buffy up in her hand and brought her close to her face. "Sorry about that, Buffy. She was having a little too much fun with your...condition. Don't you worry, though. We'll have you back all great big again, soon. Well, as big as you get, anyway. You know," she said, with an odd look in her eye, "I'm kind of excited about doing magic again."

Standing in Willow's palm at an inch tall, the look was unmistakable to Buffy. Willow's eyeballs (nearly as big as Buffy) had turned black!
111212112.title: That Old Black Magic

choices: Dark Willow grows to 100 ft. tall; Buffy groes to 10 ft.
Dark Willow grows to 500 ft. tall; Buffy grows to 50 ft.
1112121121.content:
Buffy began getting scared inside Willow's gigantic hand as black energy began to form around her. She looked down at Buffy with an evil grin as she transformed into.....Dark Willow!

"Willow! What happened to you?" Buffy screamed up at her gigantic friend.

Dark Willow only laughed evily as she closed her hand tight around Buffy, squeezing her. She squirmed trying to get loose but all she felt was incredible pain.

"Forget just making you big." Dark Willow said with an evil grin. "I rather like the idea of you being the size of a bug to me. I want EVERYONE to be the size of a bug to me. Come on, little slayer."

Dark Willow floated upwards and, with Buffy still in her hand, teleported away. She suddenly appeared right in the middle of a street in Sunnydale, floating in mid-air, and attracting some significant attention from the people.

"Hello there, insects." she said as she floated down to the ground. "Or at least, you will be."

Buffy looked on in horror as all around her, Dark Willow began to grow! Her long black hair became longer, her body became bigger and bigger, her now bare feet grew larger, the soft pale skin spreading across the pavement. But Buffy noticed that Dark Willow wasn't becoming any bigger to her- because the growth spell was affecting her inside Dark Willow's hand as well!

How big were the two of them going to get?
1112121121.title: Dark Willow wants to be big!

1112121122.content:
Anya raced into the Summers house, nearly out of breath. "Xander! Dawn!" she gasped, "We've got trouble!"

She collapsed into Xander's arms, still trying to talk through her panting. "Warren...(gasp) Buffy...(pant) tiny..." She held her index finger and thumb close together, as she finally caught her breath.

"Anya, slow down. What happened?" asked Xander, leading her to the couch. "Did something happen to Buffy?" Dawn asked, with a worried look on her face.

"That's what I've been trying to tell you!" Anya said with an exasperated look. "Warren shrunk Buffy down to an inch tall...Willow found her in her shoe...she's trying some magic on her...and we have to find Warren before he shrinks the rest of us!"

Xander and Dawn stared at each other, then back to Anya. "She's...shrunk? Like in that Rick Moranis movie?" asked Dawn, pinching her finger and thumb together for effect. "And Warren can do that to all of us?" said Xander, as Anya nodded vigorously.

Dawn glanced out the window. "Speaking of Warren...he's here!" she exclaimed, as Warren strode up the front walk.

Meanwhile, at the Magic Box, Willow had set 6 candles in a circle around the tiny Buffy. They towered over her like apartment buildings. Willow was reading through an ancient book when she suddenly exclaimed, "Aha! I knew it was in here!" She smiled down at her miniscule friend. "Are you sure about this, Willow? Shouldn't you wait for Tara?" yelled up Buffy.

"Don't worry your teeny little head about it" smirked the young witch. "I've got it covered." She began the spell.
1112121122.title: Notifying the Scoobies

choices: Willow shrinks to Buffy's size (1 inch)
Willow becomes larger or smaller than Buffy
11121211221.content:
Buffy nervously paced on the table as Willow began chanting. Although desperate to return to normal-size, she wished that the redheaded witch had waited for Tara before beginning the spell. Together their magic seemed more stable than Willow going it alone. What if Willow made things worse? Suppose Buffy were to shrink again, becoming microscopic?

Willow's giant hand slammed down next to the tiny slayer. "Stand still!" she ordered. Buffy followed her command, not wanting to anger someone who could literally crush her with their finger. Still, she worried about Willow's tone...

As she finished uttering the spell, Willow failed to notice that one of the candles had burned out. She smiled triumphantly down to her miniscule friend. "Toldja I could do it! You should start gro--uhhhh!" Suddenly her vision became blurry and she staggered back from the table. "Will! Are you alright? What's happening?" Buffy yelled up to the titanic redhead. "I-I--" Willow gasped, just before she passed out.

Buffy ran to the table's edge and peered down at her giant friend sprawled on the floor. "Will! Willow!" she yelled, with no response. She had to get down there somehow. Taking a deep breath, she leaped onto a nearby chair, the equivalent of jumping off the roof of a six-story building to the insect-sized slayer. Luckily the chair was padded; however, she still felt the shock through her body. She then took a running leap off the chair, landing in the middle of Willow's stomach. As she rolled with the force of the landing, she nearly fell into Willow's navel. The young witch still hadn't stirred. Buffy climbed onto Willow's sweater and made a mad dash towards her head. As she approached Willow's chin, Buffy noticed something. Willow looked smaller than she had a second ago. Was the spell working? With renewed determination, she latched onto a lock of her friend's hair, and used it to swing to her ear.

"Yes!" she thought, "I am getting bigger! I'm larger than Willow's ear now!" She screamed into the witch's ear, "Willow! Wake up! The spell's working! I'm---" Suddenly, Buffy looked at her surroundings. The chair, the books, everything still seemed as gigantic as before. Only Willow looked smaller. But that meant--

"Will!" she screamed even louder, as the formerly giant ear dwindled before her. "Will, you've got to wake up! The spell backfired! I'm not growing, you're shrinking!"
11121211221.title: Willow Goes Down

111212112211.content:
"Willow! Wake up! Will, you're shrinking!" Buffy desperately screamed into the rapidly dwindling ear of her best friend. In mere minutes, the redhead had shrunk to half her former size with no end in sight, as the tiny slayer watched helplessly. If only there was a way to contact the other scoobies, she thought, but the Magic Box phone was perched atop a counter that loomed overhead like a mountain.

Stunned, the miniscule blonde watched as the former giantess quickly shrank to 6 inches tall. 5 inches. 4...3...2...and finally stopping at approximately one inch tall, the same amazingly tiny stature as herself. Willow moaned softly. Buffy cradled Willow's head in her lap.

"Ohhhh...what happened? What--Buffy, is that you?" Willow blinked rapidly and focused her gaze on her friend. Suddenly, she shot up to a sitting position. "Buffy, it worked! You're back to normal size!"

"Will--"

"And you thought I needed Tara! Ha!"

"Willow, I'm not--"

"Who's the witch, baby? Huh?"

"Willow! Stop! The spell backfired!"

"Buffy, what are you talking about? Look at you! You're as big as me again...well, almost..."

Buffy grabbed Willow's shoulders. "Yeah Will, look at me...and look around at everything else! I'm still tiny, Willow! I'm still only an inch tall--and now so are you!"

Willow glanced around at the cavernous arena the Magic Box had become. "Oh my God...no, it can't be! You were so small, and now I'm...Buffy, what are we going to do?"
111212112211.title: Wee Willow

1112121122111.content:
The tiny witch and equally tiny slayer glanced around the cavernous shop. Willow's legs were shaking, and she felt as if she might pass out. "Buffy...I...everything's so huge! What do we...how..."

"I know, Will, I know." Buffy steadied her friend. "We're in a pretty frightening scenario. I've been shrunk for a couple of hours now and believe me, it's no fun. At least there's no one around to accidentally step on us. Do you have anyway of contacting anyone?"

The mini-witch thought for a moment, and then remembered "Hey! My cell phone--" She reached into her pocket, then stopped. "Oh no! I took it out before I started the spell, and put it on..." she craned her neck high up above them, "...the table. How are we gonna get up there, Buffy? It must be nearly 200 feet...er, that is 3 feet. It's like an office building! And even if we could reach it, can we use it? I mean, we're so tiny! Could we open it, activate it? Would anyone be able to hear us?"

Buffy could see Willow start to panic, and wanted to keep her positive. "Let's worry about getting up there first. Look for a cord or something to climb up and--"

Suddenly they heard a ringing bell and the door swung open.
1112121122111.title: Reduced Options

11121212.content:
Before the miniature Buffy had a chance to get her bearings inside Willow's shoe, the young witch, grossed out by the thought of the "bug", quickly ripped the sneaker off her foot and threw it aside.

"Willoooooowwwww!!!" Buffy screamed, as the huge cavern that was the shoe twisted and turned in the air. In reality, Willow had only thrown the sneaker about 18 inches away, but for the tiny slayer, the fall felt like a mile. When it landed, she spilled out onto the hard floor, dizzy and fortunately unnoticed by the two giants who would surely have crushed her underfoot if they had spotted her tiny form.

Buffy managed to weakly roll to the safety of a table leg as Willow's heel came within inches of squashing her, while kneeling to retrieve her shoe. "Did you kill it? Is it dead?" demanded Anya.

"No," said Willow, examining her sneaker, "looks like that's the one that got away." She shuddered. "Ick. A bug was crawling on my foot."

The mini-slayer grumbled to herself under the table, "Nice, Will. Way to add insult to injury. Bad enough I get shrunk, almost stepped on and thrown around in your shoe, and now I'm icky? What else can happen?" Just then, she saw a huge shadow descend on her; as she turned around, a very large spider, about twice her size, slid down a strand of web directly in front of her. "I just had to ask."
11121212.title: Escape from the shoe

choices: Try to find another way to get their attention
111212121.content:
The enormous arachnid skittered closer to the miniature slayer. "Well, I've seen the Incredible Shrinking Man, so I guess this shouldn't have been a surprise", she muttered to herself. "Where's a handy nail around when you need one?"

As the spider lunged forward, Buffy grabbed one of it's legs and swung it into the table leg. "Yuk!" she grimaced as she let go. "That was disgusting!" Undaunted the spider rose to attack again.

Meanwhile, completely oblivious to the battle taking place at their feet, Willow and Anya paced the Magic Box. "Buffy said she was going to meet us here," said Willow. "I hope nothing's happened to her--this is Sunnydale, after all."

Anya waved away her concerns. "Oh, you know how Buffy can be. It's probably no big deal."

Below, the tiny blonde gritted her teeth at Anya's offhand comment. Everything's a big deal when you're only an inch tall! Distracted, she didn't notice one of the spider's legs coming up behind her until it had literally swept her off her feet.

The giant arachnid was nearly on top of her now. Desperately, she planted both feet in the spider's midsection and using all her (diminished) slayer-strength, flipped it over her head and several inches across the floor. At that moment, Willow was in mid-pace, and her foot came crashing down on the tiny creature.

Feeling the squish, the young witch inspected the bottom of her shoe. "Ick! Spider! Anya, you need to get an exterminator in here. The bugs are taking over!" Buffy caught her breath and considered her next move.
111212121.title: Buffy the Spider Slayer

11122.content:
Buffy was shocked to see the gigantic (to her) figure of Amy, former rat and current witch, enter the Magic Box. She scattered to avoid being squashed under Amy's flip-flops.

"Hello? Anybody here? Willow? Buffy?" Amy perused the various magic paraphenalia. Buffy had recently thrown her out of the Summers house for helping to corrupt Willow with magic, and Amy was looking for something to juice her powers back up.

Buffy wondered what to do. She didn't think she could trust Amy enough to help her, but the longer she was stuck at bug-size, the more she hated it. What's more, she knew that Warren was still out there with that shrink ray! Should she try to get Amy's attention or--

Suddenly, Amy froze in her tracks. She sensed something. "There's someone here. Someone...small." Before Buffy knew what was happening, Amy dropped to her knees and snatched the tiny slayer up in her hand.

"Well, well. Somebody finally cut the great Buffy down to size." She smirked. "Nice work. Magic?"

Buffy squirmed in her fingers. "If you must know, it was a shrink ray. Put me down!"

Amy laughed. "Oh, I don't think so, squirt. You know, I didn't appreciate the way you treated me before, especially after you left me as a rat for three years. Maybe this is karma. I just might start a roach motel with you as the first tenant." She started to gather objects around the shop. "I should be able to duplicate the shrinking effect with a spell. This'll show Willow she's not so big. At least, not big for much longer."
11122.title: Amy the Witch

111222.content:
Amy scanned the shop for shrinking spell ingredients. "Let's see, I'll need newt's blood, and essence of dargon..." She glanced down at the tiny slayer squirming in her hand. "Hmmm, where can I put you to keep you out of trouble, short-stuff? Wish I'd thought to bring my purse. There wouldn't be a hamster cage around, would there? Or would that be too roomy?" She chuckled.

Buffy glared at her giant captor. "When I get back to normal-size, I'm gonna kick your ass!" Amy squeezed Buffy's ribs with her fingers, causing Buffy to cry out in pain. "Uhnn!"

"Whatever, Pee-wee! Aahh, here we go. Perfect!" Amy picked up a funnel from a shelf behind the counter. She placed the miniscule Buffy underneath it. "Now you just keep an eye out for ants and mosquitos, and I'll finish my work."

Buffy gripped the bottom of the funnel, and lifted with all her strength. It wouldn't budge. "Great" She thought. "I used to be able to kick down steel doors and throw people across city blocks. Now I'm too weak to lift a plastic funnel. Being tiny sucks!" Then she had an idea. She took a spare stake from her jacket and jammed one end under the funnel, then set another stake under the first to use as a lever. This gained her ample leverage to lift the funnel up high enough to squeeze under. She glanced around to make sure Amy hadn't spotted her. She hadn't.

Amy had just about completed assembling her spell. "Soon Willow, you are going to be in the palm of my hand. I am going to rule this town!"

Warren meanwhile, decided the safest thing to do was to find Buffy, tiny or not, before she could contact her friends. He headed back to the Magic Box, shrink ray in hand, and saw Amy hovering over a smoldering cauldron. They stared at each other unknowingly.
111222.title: Escape Attempt

1112222.content:
The fact that neither Warren nor Amy had any idea who the other was, made no difference to either of them. All that registered was a threat. A threat to be reduced.

Amy started chanting a spell, "Reducio magnio techo...", while grabbing some of the ingredients she had hastily assembled.

"Too late, sister!" sneered Warren, as he raised the shrink ray and fired. The blue light instantly enveloped Amy just as she had shoved a handful of magical trinkets in her pocket.

"...ondio pedio oh oh oh crap!" Amy squealed, her voice rising in pitch as her body dwindled quickly. Panicking, her loss of concentration causing her spell to fail, she turned to escape the giant Warren. Unfortunately, she had already shrunk below 6 inches and tripped over a pencil on the floor. When she looked up, all she could see was a giant hand reaching down towards her. She was only 1 inch tall.

"Come 'ere, you." said Warren, as he snatched her off the floor. "You wouldn't of happened to have seen a blonde 'bout your height, goes by the name of Buffy, would you?"

"Tell you what, big guy. You make me normal again, and I'll not only show you where that itty-bitty slayer is, but I'll help you make all her friends bite-size too. We'll take over the town, just you and me. What do you say?"

"I say let me get back to you about that. Meanwhile...aahh, here we go..." Warren spotted the funnel that Amy had placed Buffy under previously. "What're you---no!" Amy saw what he had in mind. He placed her under the funnel, just as she had done to Buffy minutes earlier. "I'll be back, babe." He began meticulously searching the area around the funnel for the miniature slayer.

Following her escape from the funnel, Buffy had made the amazing leap (6 inches!) to the next table and was attempting to reach the closest phone. She witnessed the fate of Amy, and though she felt a twinge of satisfaction at the poetic justice, at the same time she knew that was one less distraction to Warren's quest for her.
1112222.title: Teeny Witch

choices: Someone else enters the Magic Box
11122221.content:
Buffy, hiding behind a pencil-holder on the counter, witnessed the reduction and capture of Amy with mixed emotions. While there was a certain satisfaction in seeing the scheming witch receive a taste of her own medicine, Warren was now free to focus completely on tracking down the micro-slayer. She pondered her next move. How to get word out to the other scoobies? There was a phone next to the cash register approximately 200 feet (her scale) from where she hid. "Even if I can make it over there without Warren spotting me," she thought, "am I strong enough at this size to move the receiver, or even push the buttons?" Once again, she cursed her tiny stature. The once mighty slayer, now too small and weak to operate a telephone?

The question appeared to be moot, as the relatively-gigantic Warren was inching closer and closer to discovering her hiding spot. "Come out, come out, little Buffy!" he taunted. "You can't hide for long!"

Amy, meanwhile, was arranging the magical items she had grabbed prior to her shrinking. She began chanting, as a mist started to swirl about her inch-tall figure.

Buffy felt Warren's huge shadow fall over her as he approached her sanctuary. If she ran for the phone, he'd surely spot her; then again, if she remained, as soon as he moved the pencil-holder, she would be revealed.

Warren started to reach for the pencil-holder when he heard a rattle behind him. Turning quickly, he saw the funnel under which he had placed the tiny Amy begin to shake violently as a strange mist escaped from the top. Suddenly the funnel exploded in a shower of light and smoke, revealing the normal-sized form of Amy. "Yes! It worked!" she said.

Warren began to raise the shrink-ray, when Amy froze him in his tracks with a gesture. "Hold it, Dr. Shrinker! Are you ready to take me up on my deal, now?" she asked.
11122221.title: Itty-Bitty Buffy, Amazing Amy

111222211.content:
"Why should I?" said Warren, as he tightened his grip on the shrink ray. "Because," Amy smiled, "that spell I used to reverse your doohickey didn't just restore me. It was also a protection spell."

Warren knew next to nothing about magic. "A...protection spell?"

"Yep! You try and shrink me again and it'll be you that gets downsized. Now why not take me up on my offer to track down the slayer's gang together?"

Warren gulped as he reached his hand to shake hers.

Meanwhile the insect-sized Buffy was taking advantage of this distraction to make a desperate sprint toward the enormous telephone, which was to her, roughly the size of a parking garage. As she was mere inches from the cord, a gigantic hand swept down from the sky, cutting her off. She heard thunderous laughter from above, and gazed up at the two giants.

"Awww, look how cute she is!", smirked Amy, peering down at the tiny blonde. "She thinks she can use that big ol' phone to call her friends to come save her from big ol' us!" Thinking fast, Buffy attempted to use a short stack of post-it notes as a springboard to vault over Warren's hand, but he merely raised it up an inch, causing her to fall back to the counter. "Uh uh uh, munchkin, you're not going anywhere."

The mini slayer tried to regain her footing, but found her sides being pressed together by something metallic. She was lifted off the counter. Amy had to squint to see the look of panic on the shrunken woman's face as she squeezed her with a pair of tweezers. "Tell us where your friends are, tiny!"

Buffy struggled hopelessly against the tweezers, but remained defiant. "You can't make me talk!" she screamed, but the giants merely laughed.
111222211.title: Captured by Giants

choices: Everyone wakes up 1/4 of an inch tall
112.content:
Xander waited in the Magic Box for a meeting of the Scooby Gang. Typically, he was not the first one here, but he was able to get out of work early. At that point he hears a noise: the door opening. Finally, he thinks, we can get this shindig started.
"Well, you know guys, I was going to send a search party, but I realized that I was early and decided against it. So..."
Xander stops when he sees who enters. It is just Spike.
"Who invited you?" asks Xander, which was more of a rhetorical question.
"Shut your bleedin' trap. I was invited, same as you." replied Spike.
"Do you happen to know why the Avengers are assembling? Willow called and told me to be here as soon as I could." said Xander.
"No idea. Buffy hasn't said..." started spike, before the door the door opens and in walks Warren, Andrew, and Jonathan, with Warren holding a ray gun of some kind.
"It is time for the slayer to become the pest she always... HEY, what the hell are you two doing here?" started Warren.
"Well, we'll be kickin' your asses in a moment" replied Spike.
"Yeah, right. Take this!" Warren pulls the trigger, but nothing happens. And again.
"Dammit! It worked a second ago! Stupid broken shrink ray! I even had it set on a quarter of an inch, they would have been nothing!Arghh!"
With that, Warren throws it to the floor. It then heats up, and explodes, releasing all energy within it. It hits everyone, and knocks every one out. Then...
112.title: Malfunction

1121.content:
Xander slowly gets up. "Did anyone get the the number of that train?"

Spike, lying next to him, has already gotten up.
"Umm, boy, I don't think we are in Kansas no more."

Xander looks around. "Did we get teleported somewhere or somethin? Because, well, that would be kind of cool and HOLY CRAP!" Xander finally notices where he is. He is in front of the counter of the magic box, that rises into the distance to the point where he cannot see the top. "We're freakin' ants!" Xander exclaims.

"No shit, sherlock. Now if you don't mind, how bouts' we find the three pricks who did this and find a way to reverse this, and maybe kill em'. Maybe not in that order." said Spike,as he notices the three on the floor 100 feet from them.They run over to them.

They are just waking up. Xander asks, "So, idiots, how do we make it so that ladybugs can't kick our asses?"

"Talk, you lot, or I'll drain you dry." adds Spike.

"We, umm, never thought we would have to unshrink any thing, so the gun wasn't designed to do that. Plus, I believe that it has disintergrated."

"Well, you idiot better think of something soon, or..." Xander's comeback is interrupted by a loud noise in the distance. The door to the Magic Box opens, and in walks the incomprehensibly large figures of Buffy, Willow, and Dawn.

Xander,Spike,Warren,Andrew,and Jonathan all say the same thing, in unison.
"Oh, shit."
1121.title: The hole deepens...

choices: Run towards them, in an attempt to contact them.
Stay where they are, hoping to be found.
11211.content:
Buffy entered the magicbox with her little sister Dawn and Best friend witch Willow with one thing on her mind: How to get rid of that annoying Trio of "masterminds". They are more likely to hurt themselves than their intended target, her.

As soon as she entered the shop, she noticed a smell. "Do you guy's smell that? It's like a bomb went off. And where the hell are Xander and Spike? I thought they would be here by now."

Willow adds, "Well, maybe they ran off together. Well all know they are the best of friends." A look from Buffy had her add, " Okay, joking not too funny right now. Got it."

"Maybe it was traffic?" forwarded Dawn.

"Or maybe something happened to them. Let's take a look around." says buffy.

With that, they start to move around the magic shop, in search of any clues.
-----------------

Before the three moved from the doorway to begin the search, the five on the floor were in a state of panic.

"Oh,crapOh,crapOh,crap" repeated jonathan.

Spike began to take stock of them as they stood in the doorway. His eyes instantly went to Buffy. She wore a white shirt underneath a black jacket of sorts, with blue jeans and tennis shoes. Her long blond hair was down and ran loose about her shoulders. Willow wore a tight red short sleeve shirt and blue jeans, also with tennis shoes and shoulder length red hair, straightend. Dawn wore an a red shirt covered with a jean jacket, with blue jeans and tennis shoes.

"Well, what do we do know?" was the obvious question, asked by Xander.
11211.title: Arrival

112111.content:
"It's obvious what we have to do." stated Xander. "Our only chance is to be found by our friends. Willow might know a spell that can change us back."

"So who do we climb like a bleedin' mountain, the witch, the slayer, or the girl?" asked spike.

"You guys are nuts!" said Warren. "They'll crush us without blinking an eye. We're too small. And we are not going to run with you two. if you have a death wish, fine, But the trio will figure out something else."

"So you wanna just seperate? IF... when we get help, what if we can't find you? You are idiots, that is for sure, but you don't deserve to be..." Xander is interrupted by a crash of thunder and the proceeding earthquake. Looking up, they see the three girls have begun to move from the doorway, buffy in the lead, and coming right for them. Willow and Dawn follow behind.
"Run!!" yelled Xander.
==============

Buffy walked toward the counter, stopped, and looked over it. Nothing. Willow moved past her to look in the back, in the training room. Dawn stood next to buffy, annoyance flashing in her eyes.

"I don't think they were here, Buffy. Let's just go home. I'm tired from school and crave some kind of afterschool snack." complained Dawn.

Buffy stared at her. "Maybe your right, and I'm just smelling things. Let's get willow and go. I haven't seen anything suspicious. I'll try to call Xander when we get home, and swing by Spike's Crypt when I go on patrol tonight."
================

Though their feet had flown over head, no one had come to any harm. Except for jonathan, who tripped and fell, but he's better now. They stood together and stared at the immense Buffy and Dawn at the counter, and considered.

"Well, who should be our personal Mount Everest?" Xander asked the group.
112111.title: dangers and decisions

choices: Buffy pauses to tie her shoe
1121111.content:
"We definitely have to go for Buffy. She is the best choice. Plus, she is shorter than Dawn."

As Xander said this, most everyone nodded in agreement, with the exception of Warren, who just glowered up at the immense form of Buffy. Xander then added "We should probably go know, before they leave and leave us here to kill each other."

"All right all. This will be a treat, Aren't you all excited? Let's climb that Buffy mountain!" said Spike in a sarcastic tone. "Well, you pansies commin'?" With that, the five of them took off at a sprint towards Buffy's tennis Shoe.

Xander ran right behind Spike, toward the mass of blue and white ahead of them: Buffy's shoe. Now nearly there, the shoe rose above all of them, by the best estimates 20 stories or more to the ankle, which is covered by the blue jeans.

Stopping just in front of the side of the shoe, they looked up in awe.

"How are we supposed to climb up that?" yelled Warren, obviously scared out of his mind.

"Well," began Spike, "You look to the left about 50 feet and look at the shoelace. You move over to said shoelace, grab onto the weave, and climb. We'll see where it takes us from there."

Sure enough, to the left was a gigantic shoelace. It's plastic tipped end is a good 30 feet long, and the lace itself is about that far across. At this size the weave of the lace is easy to climb.

Now by the shoelace, the five grab on, beginning the climb.

"Good thing Buffy never learned that all too important childhood lesson of tieing her shoes." says Xander.

They are halfway up the lace, nearly to the top of the shoe, when the world suddenly moves.

"AHHHHHHHHHH!" they all scream (except for Spike, of course) as the shoelace begins to swing. Buffy has begun to walk.
================================

Let's get going, Willow. I think it was just my imagination." Buffy calls into the training room.

Willow emerges from the room, worry on her face. "I called and talked to Xander. He said he would be here. It's not like him."

I know. We'll chew him out later. Let's just get home, then we'll call him." replied Buffy.

"Oh, OK. It's been a long day anyway."
with that, Willow begins to follow Buffy and Dawn out of the Magic shop.
1121111.title: Starting out and Giving up

11211111.content:
Suddenly, the movement stopped. Everyone stopped screaming, except for Andrew, of course.

"Oh, thank goodness. It stopped. Oh, that was beyond terrifying." said Jonathan.

"Why did she stop walking, do you think..." Xander was interrupted by a sudden movement of the shoe. Still hanging to the shoelace, they all look up to see Buffy's face looking down at them, with her fingers reaching for them.

"Ahhh! AHHHH! She's going to kill us! I knew she would find me. Stupid Bi..." Warren was interrupted when Buffy grabbed onto the end of the lace, her fingers the size of office buildings.

"God, I hope she sees us. I also hope she doesn't think we are bugs. It could end badly." thought Xander as the fingers came down.
11211111.title: Panicking

choices: They make it to her sock
They don't and fall into her shoe
11211112.content:
The five passengers of Buffy's untied shoelace held on tight, inspite of the constant swaying motion, and the strong winds that whipped by them as the shoe was in motion. And eventually, they stopped screaming. Well, except for Andrew.

"If that bleeding pansy ever going to shut his hole?" Spike asked Xander, who was holding tight to the fabric of the shoelace beside him.

" No, I don't think so." replied Xander. " How about we just let him get it all out now, so that maybe later, you know, he won't."

Then, they stopped. Instead of constantly moving forward, the shoe they were on moved up and came to an abrupt stop.

"We must be in the car. She's probably headed home. Now is our chance to figure out what we are going to do. Any ideas?" forwarded Xander after the stop.

" I have a GREAT idea. How's about we finish what we started out doin', Huh? Let's get climbing!" No one disagreed with Spike's statement, so they began their climb anew.

Eventually, they managed to reach the top of the shoe, and all of them layed down and rested on the tounge of the sneaker that lays between the laces.

" Now what, great leader?" Andrew asked Spike.

" Since when was he appointed leader? I want a recount." drowled Xander.

"We keep climbing, I'd say." said Spike, who then gazed up, seeing only an immense wall that was Buffy's denim pantleg.

"Are you nuts? That's suicide. I am not climbing some bitch that I should be killing!!" exclaimed Warren.

"Oh, now is not the time for this. We have to figure out a way to get out of this mess, all of us. We don't have time for petty grudges." said Xander, stepping between Warren and a murderous looking Spike.

"Speak for yourself." growled Spike, who was now in full vamp face. "I think i'm gonna kill this stupid ponce."

"Hey, hey! I didn't mean it, hold on! We're in this together, just like Xander said. You might need my help, to get full size again. It was my shrink ray that did this, right?" Warren said, his fear apparent in his eyes. He did not know that Spike could not attack humans, and so now feared for his life.

Spike's face morphed back to normal. "Maybe you're right, mate. Won't kill ya this time. But badmouth her again, and I will drain ya dry."

"Look," Xander began, "I don't know how long this Car ride is, but I think we had better start climbing that tounge to her jeans, cause we have a long way to go."

With everyone agreed, they began to climb the hundred or so feet to the top of the sneaker tounge. Everyone was nearly to the top when the mountain on which they climbed moved.

"THEY MUST BE HOME. HOLD ON TIGHT!" yelled Xander.
-------------------------------------

After the longer than usual trip home(traffic was horrible, which is strange, for a small town like sunnydale), they finally arrived home. Willow drove, with Buffy in the passenger seat and Dawn in back. All Buffy wanted to do was get inside and take a load off her feet. She had been busy all day, and wanted to rest a bit before she went out on patrol.

"I am totally ready to just veg out in front of the T.V for a couple of hours." Said Buffy as she climbed out of the car.

"Yeah, it's been a long day. I'm still worried about Xander though." said Willow as they walked up to the house.

"Oh, i'm sure he's fine. He's probably tied up at work. You know our Xander, he works hard for the money." replied Buffy.

"Yeah, you're probably right. I'ts just, you know, living on a hellmouth and everything, you never know what could have happened."

"Well, just call his house to see if Anya has heard anything. He might have just lost track of time, you know," Buffy looked behind her a Dawn, who didn't seem to be paying attention, "Washing Anya's windows."

"I'm not sure if we should hope for that or not." Willow said as she stepped inside.

When they got inside, Dawn went straight to the kitchen, most likely to get something to eat. Buffy slipped out of her shoes and walked upstairs, to change into something a bit more comfortable.
----------------------------------

The five held on at the top of the tounge as Buffy walked up to the door. When she stepped through the door and stopped, They moved quickly. They stood up, the wall of Denim ahead of them.

"We have to jump! Are we ready?" Asked Xander.

"I didn't see myself doing this when I woke up this morning." said Jonathan, mostly to himself.

Xander began to speak again.

"Okay, on three. ONE, TWO, THREE!"

On three, all five jumped. But at that exact moment, Buffy decided to slip her socked feet out of her shoes. In midair, the Denim wall was rapidly replaced by a fuzzy white plain, that was moving quickly away.

Everyone was thinking the same thing.

"Well, this sucks."
11211112.title: Fight then flight

112111121.content:
BAMPFH!

Xander, along with everyone else, had jumped just in time. His arms and hands outstretched, he grabbed a hold of the white cloth, which was now visibly made up of criss-crossed white fabric. Underneath, he could see the peach flesh of Buffy's foot. They had landed just beyond the nail of the big toe, as far as he could tell. He had no time to think of something funny to say about his and everyone else's situation before his world went into motion, with gale force winds whipping around him. He was too busy holding on for dear life to get a good look at where Buffy was headed.
112111121.title: Grabbing and Holding

1121112.content:
"We definitely need to go for Buffy. She's the best choice. Plus, she's shorter than Dawn."

Unfortunately, as soon as Xander said this, the immense form of Buffy began to walk, thankfully not toward the group. "HEY WILL..." Buffy's voice echoed as she walked to the other room.

"Well, that slim's our choices a bit, doesn't it now?" said Spike. "Let's go you lot, while she's still, and towards that shoelace. That's awful convenient to climb."

After quite a bit of running, they approach a massive red and white nike tennis shoe. Smack dab beside it, it stretches into the sky.

"I can't even see the top of that thing. How are we supposed to climb that?" questioned Jonathan.

"I would suppose grabbing onto this shoelace here and climbing it, for a start." answered Spike sardonically. The shoelaces' tip was a good thirty feet long, the lace itself about that wide. The loose lace streched up the side of the shoe, up up and up, into the distance.

"Apparently Dawn never learned to tie her shoe, lucky for us." said Xander. "Well, what are we waiting for?"

With that, the 5 grabbed onto the woven white material and begun to climb.

Halfway up, Xander says in an exasperated breath, "Well, at least we are fast climbers. Halfway up in only a couple minutes?"

"Must be a side effect of the shrinking. The pull of gravity must be less or something..." Andrew never completed his thought. At that point, an immense shadow over came the group...
===================================

After waiting a couple minutes while Buffy and Willow talked in the other room, Dawn began to fidget. She looked down and noticed that she had a shoelace untied. At that point Buffy and Willow were beginning to come into the room. Not wanting to waste time and just wanting to get home to eat, Dawn hastily bent over and grabbed the shoelace, sticking it down into the side of her shoe. She wore no socks, so it wasn't uncomfortable. Plus, she was going to be home in a few minutes, and she would change out of them then.

"Well, are we ready to go?" asked a hopeful Dawn.

"Yeah. It's weird of Xander not to show. Spike I believe, but..." Buffy trailed off. "Ah, let's just go."

With that, the three walked out of the door, locking it behind them, and headed for home.
1121112.title: Climbing accident

choices: They manage to grab onto her  foot as it leaves
They stay stuck to the shoelace
11211121.content:
Xander was uncomfortable. It was dark, with a weird smell in the air. He, Spike, and the three idiots still held onto the shoelace, which had been shoved into Dawn's shoe. All of them were caught between the shoelace and the skin on the side of Dawn's foot. Xander squirmed, but like everyone else, was stuck where he was.
"It's too bad she didn't wear socks today." said Spike.
"Yeah, it doesn't smell to good here. I mean, it's not horrible, at least she bathes, but, still..." Andrew rambled, until Spike interrupted him.
"No, I meant if she were wearing socks, we could climb, or something. Something to grab onto, 'sides skin, though I think we are small enough to climb the wrinkles..."
"Oh, this is so freakin' horrible. We are stuck in the Slayer's sister's shoe, when we should be celebrating the defeat of the Slayer. That stupid bitch, I just wanna..." said Warren, who was interrupted in the middle of his rant by Spike.
"You better shut your bleedin' trap 'for I shut it for you, you stupid git." Warren was silent.
"Well, it's good we are being SO constructive with all this bickering, but maybe we should be figuring out, I don't know, how to get out of this, or maybe what we are going to do." says Xander. "As soon as Dawn takes off this shoe, we will be free to continue our quest, right? So, what should we do? Suggestions?"
For a while, no one said anything. The whole world moved as Dawn walked home.
Suddenly, the movement stopped. Dawn had stopped walking. Then, the skin-wall they were pressed against began to move. She was taking off her shoe!
"Well, it looks like we are gonna have to wing it!"
11211121.title: Between some skin and a shoe lace

112111212.content:
"Hold on everybody!" shouted Xander as the world around them upheaved. Dawn's foot, now leaving the shoe, was moving the lace out also. The lace moved with her foot, shooting out over the side of the shoe.

"Ahhhhhhh!" This time, everybody screamed. The world zoomed by as the tiny passengers clung to the shoelace, which flipped over the side of the shoe and banged up against it's side. All five of them still clung tight.

Xander was breathing hard. Still holding onto the lace, he was just loving being alive.
"You know, I never was one for roller coasters. And discovering, that still holds true."

"Well, what do we do know? Dawn has walked away. We missed our chance!" Andrew whined.

Xander heard Spike to his side.
"We'll just get down from here and bloody well walk to one of them to get help. Honestly, you blokes get whiney about the simplest things. Now, let's..." Spike was interrupted by rumbling. The whole shoe vibrated, slightly.
"Oh, what the hell..."

Spike stopped his curse to look up with everyone else to see the towering form of Buffy, looking down at the shoe. Her face then snapped up and she yelled, "DAWN! WHAT DID I TELL YOU ABOUT LEAVING YOUR SHOES IN FRONT OF THE DOOR! MOVE THEM, NOW!"

"Well," began Spike, "It looks like we might get that second chance."
============================

When Dawn arrived home, she had one thing on her mind: food. Like all teenagers, she was hungry most all the time. After slipping off her shoes as soon as she got in the door, she walked quickly to the kitchen to get her favorite afterschool snack, a bowl of cheerios.(with sugar, of course.) Alas, as soon as she got to the kitchen, she heard Buffy yell.

"Dawn! What did I tell you about leaving your shoes in front of the door! Move them, now!"

She was only upset because last time, she tripped over Dawn's discarded shoes. The thought brought a smile to Dawn's face. All those slayer reflexes and training, and she trips over a shoe. She also didn't want to hear Buffy yell again, so she went. Walking back toward the entrance, Dawn glares at Buffy, and says

" You couldn't have waited a half an hour? Was this really that dire? You're right, this ranks up there with the Apocalypse."

Buffy just rolls her eyes. "Just put them in your room."

With a grunt, Dawn bends down,grabbs the shoes, and clutching them to her chest, runs up the stairs.
==============================

The five hear Dawn come in and exchange words with Buffy. Then, they see a massive teenage hand descend upon them. The hand misses the shoelace, but grabs the shoe, and lifts it. Winds rushes by, and Xander feels ready to puke.
Then, they are all slammed into red fabric. Dawn's shirt.

"Oooh, Downy fresh" cracks Andrew.

"All right, this is our chance. This is our ride. We just need to jump over to the red and we will be a short climb away from freedom. Who's with me?" After Xander said this, they began to argue.

"What if we fall off?" asked Jonathan.

"You'd be doin' the world a favor." replied Spike.

"I think this is a bad idea." says Warren.

"Do you have any better ones? Cause i'm listening. Except, time is a little short." Asked Xander. The world swayed by as Dawn ran up the stairs. "We have to go!"

With a final nod, everyone agrees.

"Okay on one, two, three, JUMP!" screams Xander, and they all throw themselves onto the red fabric. This is just in time, as Dawn opens her door and throws her shoes in.

"All right, now, what next?" asked Spike to no one in particular.
===========================

Dawn ran down the stairs toward the kitchen, unaware of the 4 men and a vampire holding onto the red shirt covering her left breast.
112111212.title: Hitching a ride

1121112121.content:
Dawn raced down the stairs, intent on obtaining what she desired most of all: her after school snack. She could taste the cherrios now, all crunchy and purportedly healthy... Then she realized she was fantasizing about cereal, and thought that maybe she should consider getting a lunch at school more often. She walked into the kitchen, and was grabbing a bowl from the cupboard when she heard Buffy yelling, yet again.

"Hey Dawn! Will you pour me a bowl of cherrios too?" Buffy's voice reverberated from the basement.

"Why don't you make it yourself?" Dawn yelled back.

"I am folding YOUR laundry, so I am busy. Please?"

"Fine, since I am your slave, no problem." Dawn was annoyed. Now it would take that much longer to sit down and eat. She grabs a second bowl out of the cupboard and, grabbing the cereal box, begins to fill both bowls.

--------------------------------

Meanwhile, Xander, Spike, Andrew, Jonathan, and Warren clung to Dawn's sweater for dear life. Dawn's movement down the stairs almost threw them off, and now her seemingly jerky movements were threatening to do it again.

"Why doesn't she just sit down, of fall asleep?"
asked Andrew, clinging fiercely to the red material.

"I don't see that happening any time soon. It seems to me like she is having a snack." said Spike.

Her movement stops.

"Finally! Oh, thank God! Thank god..." Jonathan muttered.

" Looks like we can begin that climb. And remember gentlemen, don't look down." After Xander said this, they all began an upward movement.

-----------------------------------

Dawn poured both bowls full of cherrios, then turned to the refrigerator and grabbed the milk. With a steady hand she poured both bowls. Then, she stopped, hovering over both bowls. Should she use sugar? No, one has to watch her figure, after all. She notices that some of the milk jugs persperation got onto her hands. Hearing Buffy walk up the stairs, Dawn quickly brushed her hands down the front of her sweater, and upon grabbing her bowl and spoon, began to walk quickly to the living room. She wanted to beat Buffy to the T.V. She always hogs it, but not this time...

-------------------------------------

"We're doing pretty good. We'll make it to her neck in two, maybe three years!" growled Warren angrily.

"Well, maybe you should have thought about that when you shrank us to be smaller than an ant. In the future, you know, just be aware." Xander snapped.

Spike began, " Well, you know, we're makin' pre'ey good time, if you two betty's would do more climbing and less complaining..." He was cut off when the fabric quaked violently. Everyone looked up to see a wall of flesh 40 feet high racing toward them: the side of Dawn's hand. The five had no time to react before they were smashed by the flesh wall, and swatted off the fabric. They all fell together, seemingly falling forever. They all landed with a splash! in a white liquid: Milk.

They all began to bob to the surface, sputtering and choking in the sea of milk.

"What...the bloody...hell... Where are we?" sputtered Spike, still spitting out milk.

We seem to be in a bowl of cherrios, which doesn't bode well for us, I think." replied Xander. "Lets all grab onto this" with that, Xander swam over to a small island, with a grainy texture. It was twice as tall as any of them, but they could hold onto the grainy side.

Once everyone joined them, Spike asked,

"We heard Buffy was having a bowl, too. The question is, whose bowl are we in?"
1121112121.title: climbing and falling (and splashing)

11211121211.content:
Buffy walked up the stairs from the basement towards the kitchen. At the top of the stairs she watched Dawn whizz by, intent on grabbing the T.V. first. This didn't bother Buffy so much; At least Dawn would be quiet and leave her alone for a few minutes. She looked forward to enjoying her bowl of cereal in peace and quiet.

Buffy walked into the kitchen, and walked over to her prepared bowl of cheerios. She has been busy all day, and hasn't had time to eat a thing. Next time, she thought, i'll eat my breakfast at the designated breakfast time. Pulling up a stool, she grabs a spoon and digs in for her first bite.
----------------------------------------

The five tiny men floated in the milk, clutching the side of the cheerio, preparing for the worst.

"Hey, maybe we shouldn't be holding onto this. As it is to be eaten and all, maybe not the best idea to be hanging onto it." Said Spike.

"How else do you think we're going to get out of this bowl?" asked Xander.

"Well, I was kinda not hoping on a spoon, to someone's mouth." Spike countered.

"Look, it's simple. All we have to do is stick together and jump off this undoubtedly healthy grain cereal piece at the same time, thus eluding a munchy, crunchy death." Said Xander, a bit of fear entering his voice toward the end of his sentence.

"We're going to die, arn't we?" asked Jonathan, to no one in particular.

"Wait! Does Buffy have a really smart dog? Cuz' in that movie, 'Honey I shrunk the Kids', the dog saved that kid who was going to be eaten. So maybe if she has a dog, you know..." Said Andrew, trailing off when he noticed the withering stares everyone else was giving him.

"Is he wrong in the head?" Asked Spike.

"No time for that, look!" yelled Andrew. Everyone's gaze turned skyward, as the looming face of Buffy appeared, her blond hair flowing over her shoulders. Suddenly, a silver object appeared in the sky, it's size boggling their mind: a spoon.

"AHHHHHHHHH!" screamed Jonathan and Andrew in unison, who immediately began to swim toward the edge of the bowl.

"No, you idiot's! Stick together!" yelled Xander, but to no avail.

"I don't think they liked your plan." Said Spike.

"Screw this. You guys can get eaten by that bitch if you want, but not me. I'll show her..." Said Warren, as he began to swim off toward Jonathan and Andrew.

Xander was about to swim off toward them, to reason with them, but was stopped by Spike's hand on his chest.

"Their ain't nothing we can do for those stupid ponces now. If they want to get killed, well... I'm not going to shed any tears." Said Spike.

"That's because your evil. And as much as I hate to say it, your right. There's nothing we can do." Said Xander, right before the spoon hit the hills of cheerios behind them.

"Hold on!" yelled Xander as the cheerio they were attached to was pushed to the side by the force.
-------------------------------------

Buffy dipped her spoon in the cereal absentmindedly, her thoughts elseware. It worried her that neither Xander nor Spike showed up for the meeting, and Willow's worry added to her own. What if Willow was right, and Xander was in danger? Buffy found that she wasn't too worried about Spike's well being. After eating, she was going to talk to Willow and maybe even pay a visit to Xander's apartment. She had to make sure he was okay. Then, Buffy brought the first spoonfull of cheerios to her mouth, and took her first bite. After she chewed and swallowed, she realized how hungry she was, and quickly dug in for more.
11211121211.title: Splitting up

choices: Follow the remaining 2/3rd's  of the Trio
112111212111.content:
As Andrew and Jonathan swam for what was indeed their very lives, Warren, a couple strokes behind them in the white sea, could only think of one thing: Revenge. Somehow, this situation was Buffy's fault. She always foils his plans, always foils him! Why couldn't this just go to plan? Stealing Fort Knox would have been so...cool, especially with one less Slayer in the world. He knew one day he would end her, one day she would die screaming in fear, in pure terror, as he...

Warren's inopportune focus cost him much, as a metallic wall slid between him and the more focused and thus much faster two-thirds of the Trio.

"Ah Crap!" Warren said, as he made an attempt to double back. Unfortunately, the spoon was much, much faster than he could compete with. It slid under him, deep beneath the milk, accumulating sunken cheerios and acquiring some that floated on either side of the retreating Warren. All was still for a moment, and then the world around Warren seperated from milk sea and began to make its ascent skyward.

----------------------------------------------

Buffy dipped another spoon into her cereal, and then her thoughts began to drift toward the inept thorns in her side, the Trio,or whatever dorky name they had given themselves. She wondered where they would turn up next...no matter, she would deal with it when it comes, like she did everything. She would see it through, she always did. She realized that she had been holding her spoon out and staring off into space, and relieved that no one had been around for that slightly comical sight, brought the spoon to her mouth, opened wide, and took another bite. She chewed lazily, then swallowed.

-----------------------------------------

Warren world stopped for a moment, and he was able to see the undefinable sight of a Mountain-sized slayer. With her blond hair cascading and those beautiful lips, Warren might have found her attractive if a. He didn't hate her and want to kill her and b. She wasn't about to eat him.

"BUFFY! BUFFY DOWN HERE! BUUUFFFFFYY!!!" He began to scream as he was brought to her lips, which opened to reveal giant rows of white teeth, a monstrous snake-god of a tongue, and a black abyss.

"NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO-" His screams were cut off as he was deposited into the mouth of the slayer, who preceded to chew. The world was a hellish conglomeration of chewed cheerios, saliva deep enough to drown in, and the constant thrashing of the landscape of her tongue. He narrowly avoided a quick death of being crushed between her teeth as he began to slide back, half buried in chewed food, to the back of her throat. Then she swallowed, cheerios, Warren, and all.
112111212111.title: Follow the Trio

112112.content:
"We stay right here. There will be not of that 'We better climb them to get their attention' crap. That's how a bloke gets killed." Answered Spike.

"Oh, and staying in one spot so that they can crush us with one easy step is a GREAT idea!" Xander answered back.

"Umm, guys..." started Andrew.

"WHAT?" said Xander and Spike in unison.

"RUN!!!" with that yell, Andrew began to run to catch up with Jonathan and Warren, who had already started to hoof it.

That was when Spike and Xander both noticed the three girls walking toward them. Willow was in the lead, and her Sneakered foot was bearing down on them.

Spike and Xander then also began to run to escape being crushed into the floor. The shadow of the enormous sneaker, easily the size of a small town, began to bear down on them. With a ground shaking crash, it lands just behind racing forms of Xander and Spike, the air displaced throwing them both into the air and concequently crashing to the ground. Then Willow's foot again took off into the air, landing far ahead of them, in front of the still running forms of the Trio. She seemed to be walking into the back room. As Xander and Spike began to pick themselves up off the the floor, another shadow overtook them.
--------------------------------

As Willow began to investigate the back room, and Buffy by the counter, Dawn walked over to her older sister. All she wanted to do was go home and grab something to eat, but when Buffy told her after school that there was going to be a Scooby meeting, she knew it would be a while. Sure, Dawn enjoyed going to the meetings, but her gnawing hunger plagued her and her curiosity fled. While walking over to Buffy to suggest just going home, Buffy turned to her, looked down, then back up to her.

"Hey Dawn, now I know I remember teaching you how to tie your shoes. Or is that just a hip new thing kids are doing today? 'Cause if so, i'm sure that will go the way of the rubber braclets."

Dawn looked down to see that her right shoelace was untied. She knew that with her lack of grace,that was an accident waiting to happen.

"Fine, i'll tie it, but only if we can get going and get something to eat! I'm starved, and it's apparent that Spike and Xander found something more exciting to do then come to this meeting. Like, I don't know, sleeping?" said Dawn.

"Just tie it." was Buffy's comeback.

Dawn then bent down to tie her shoe, and as she moved to pick up her loose shoelace, movement next to it caught her eye. She then bent down to take a closer look...
--------------------------------

With coinciding crashes, two enormous sneakers slammed down on either side of Xander and Spike. There, they stopped moving. Figuring they were saved for the moment, the two men, still on the ground, got up quickly and dusted themselves off. Too their right, and enormous shoelace rested on the ground, apparently loose from the sneaker.

"Who is it?" asked Xander. Whoever it was, their face was so far up that it could not be seen.

"It's the little bit. Or, the formally little and now bleedin' gigantic bit."

"What do we do?" asked Xander.

"I'm thinking that we should reconsider the climbing plan." said Spike, as he pointed to the shoelace.

"Hey, you were the one against it in the first place."

"Oh,well. Yet again i'm the bad guy. 'Magine that. Well, are you commin?"

"Sure, why not? I due to be..." Xander's cynical comeback was cut short when the enormous form above them began to move, and not to walk.

"She's crouching, to tie her shoelace! This is our chance, mate! HEY! HEY BIT! DOWN HERE!"
Spike began to yell. Xander, processing what was happening, soon began to join him, waving his arms and screaming at the top of his lungs.
"DOWN HERE, DAWNIE!"

Her mind boggling huge hand, one that could hold a stadium in it's palm, loomed over the the loose shoelace, then stopped. Her face took up the entire sky as it peered down on them.

"DOES SHE SEE US?" Yelled Xander, still waving his arms.

"I THINK WE ARE ABOUT TO FIND OUT!" answered Spike.
112112.title: Contact Attempt

1121121.content:
Dawn peered down at the what she thought were small ants on the floor, and were about to stand up to put them out of their misery when she noticed something very odd. They didn't move like normal bugs, that is scurry away on numerous legs. They seemed to be standing, on two legs no less, and jumping up and down. She couldn't make out their features, but one thing stood out. On of these "bugs" had bleach-blond hair. Her eyes widened as she peered closer.

"Hey, Buffy?" Dawn asked, eyes not straying from the two forms on the floor.

Buffy still standing at the counter and wondering why Dawn is staring at the floor, replied "Yes, Dawn?"

"How many bugs have bleach-blond hair?" Dawn asked in a sort of strangled voice.

If Buffy was expecting a question, that was not it. "Huh?"

"And stand on two legs, and... wear black leather jackets?" continued Dawn, more of a hush to her voice now.

"What the hell are you talking about?" said buffy, walking over to wear Dawn kneeled on the floor. As Buffy approached, her sneakered feet stopped in front of the spot on the floor Dawn was gazing at.

"Hey! Watch wear you place your feet! Buffy!" said Dawn, her arm lashing out, her hand grabbing Buffy's shin.

"What's going on?" Buffy asked, now kneeling with Dawn.

"Do you see those two, on the floor?" Dawn asked, her voice a little panicked.

Buffy leaned down, and saw what registered to her as two gnat-ish things on the ground in front of her. "Oh, Dawn, those are just some...gross.."

"I...I think that's Spike, and Xander." Dawn said, looking into Buffy's eyes.

"Wha...What?" said Buffy as she leaned down, taking a closer look. Her slayer enhanced vision stared, and her eyes began to grow large.
"Oh." Buffy now knew what Dawn said to be the truth. On the floor, smaller than ants, were her best friend, and well...Spike. "OH, god!" Buffy exclaimed, the breath escaping her mouth sending the two on the floor flying backwards what would be to them quite a few feet.

"Buffy!" Dawn hissed.

Buffy quickly covered her mouth, realizing her mistake, and then bent down to whisper,"Oh, god, i'm so sorry! Xander! Are you all right?"

She could tell they were moving, but could not hear a thing. Slowly, her feet planted, Buffy stood up, and Dawn joined her.

"I don't think we can move, we might lose them. Hey, Willow!" Buffy said, and Willow, who had been in the back room, came out with a puzzled look on her face.

"Did you find anything? I couldn't find..." Willow noticed the look on both Dawn and Buffy's face and stopped. "What's wrong?"

Buffy looked at Willow and said,
"Willow, something strange is going on."

Willow began to walk toward's Buffy. "What do you mean?"

Buffy held a hand up and said "Stop. Don't move. I think I'll just have to show you. Dawn, stay still."

Buffy then bent back down onto the floor, and saw that the two shrunken figures still stood their ground. "Hey guys," Buffy began in a hushed but articulate and steady voice, "I'm going to put my nail on the ground, and I want you to climb into it, so that we can get you off the floor. Okay?" Buffy didn't expect an answer, but said it anyway. Lowering her hand palm up, she laid her index fingernail on the ground, tilting it so that the two could climb into the bottom of the nail. After the two had done so, she moved the hand very slowly off the floor, and bringing that nail to the cupped palm of her left hand, deposited the two in the palm. Without taking her eyes of the two figures now laying in the palm of her hand, Buffy walked over to Willow and said, "I think something shrunk Xander and Spike."

Willow's eyes widened. "What?"
1121121.title: Finally found

113.content:
Jonathan and Andrew asked if the ray had a reverse switch on it, just in case one or all of them somehow got shrunk. Warren smiled and said of course it does. He switched the gun and pointed it at the chair and the chair was returned to normal.

Now lets go to the magic box, our hidden cameras have shown the only one there is Dawn. The three of them enter the shop and startle Dawn. What do you three want. Just this. Warren pointed the gun at Dawn and said now you will litteraly be Buffys "little" sister. He pulled the trigger and a green light hit Dawn. Green Warren thought. Oh no I left it on reverse. To their dismay Dawn was growing not shrinking. Dawns head hit the ceiling and she was still growing. Her foot knocked Warren down and he dropped the gun. Lets get out of here. The Three of them ran leaving the gun on the floor. Dawn burst through the roof of the building and stopped growing when she was twice as tall as the building. She see the gun and the three of them running away.
113.title: Rising Dawn

115.content: So who else will it be?
115.title: Who else?

1152.content:
(This only two choices option is bugging the hell out me, so I'm writing off on a tangent here, continuing from the last chapter. If anyone wanted to use the Anya option, I included it below)

"So," grinned Warren, "How do we put this use?"

"Oh, I know!" shouted Andrew, "Let's shrink all the world's monuments"

Warren's smile vanished.

"I'm looking for a plan that actually accomplishes something," he said, angrily.

Jonathan still looked shocked that the gun had actually worked.

"Can this shrink... people?" he asked.

Warren's smile flashed back onto his face as he spun around.

"Let's find out," he beamed.

Instantly a flash shot out the barrel of the gun and hit Jonathan dead in the chest. He barely had time to scream as the blue light enveloped him. The scream became higher and higher pitched as he was instantly reduced to six inches in height. Andrew ran over and kneeled down, half amazed and half terrified of Warren. Below him was a miniature version of his friend.

Warren continued to grin as he tapped some buttons on the side of the gun. He leveled the gun at the mini-Jonathan, causing Andrew to squeal and leap out of the way, crashing into a pile of carboard boxes.

This time a red light shot from the gun and, within seconds, Jonathan was restored to his original size, though he was shaking in fear.

"Looks like it can make them bigger, too," Warren said, fiendishly.
1152.title: Detour...

11521.content:
It was almost midnight outside the First National Bank of Sunnydale. Across the street, Andrew, Warren, and Jonathan sat in their van and studied the building.

"What are we going to do?" asked Jonathan, "Shrink down to microscopic size and sneak into the vault?"

"Do you want to be microscopic?" asked Warren.

"No," frowned Jonathan like a shamed child.

"There's a much easier way," said Warren, rolling down the window and leveling the shrink ray at the bank, "Let me just expand the shrinking field..."

With that he pressed a few buttons and pulled the trigger. Once again, a blue light shot from the device, but this time enveloping the entire building. There was a crashing sound as parts tore from the foundation, but in an instant there was a miniature bank exactly where the original had stood.

The trio climbed from the van and ran over to it.

"Help me get it into the van," shouted Warren.

Soon they had the entire bank, the size of a doll's house, in the back of their vehicle. They started the car and drove a few blocks down to get away from the scene of the crime before inspecting their prize.

Warren climbed into the back and sat down next to the bank. He pulled the roof off with his bare hand, revealing a vault filled with tiny slips of money. Putting a pile down on the ground, he pressed some more buttons and blasted it. There was a red blast that enveloped the pile, but it quickly faded and nothing seemed to happen.

"Damnit," shouted Warren tossing the pile back into the van and the gun to Jonathan, "I was afraid of this. The power's shot from shrinking something so big. I'm gonna have to recharge it back at the lair."

He climbed out the back and took the driver's seat, but when he turned on the lights, he found someone standing directly in front of the car.

It was Buffy, dressed for slaying in her black leather jacket and clutching a wooden stake.

"I really don't want to know what you three are doing out in here in the middle of the night," she said, looking somewhat bored by their presence.

"Buffy," grinned Jonathan who was moving around to get in the side door, "What a nice little surprise. And I do mean 'little'."

Warren groaned and shouted, "Get in the car, you idiot. It's out of power!"

But it was too late. Jonathan pointed the gun at Buffy and pulled the trigger. A light hit her and rapidly faded away.

Buffy looked up, even more bored.

"Wow. That's a nice laser gun," she said, "Don't you hate when people point those at the screen during movies?"

Jonathan shrieked and jumped into the van, which promptly sped off into the night.

"Idiots," said Buffy and, being a quiet night, headed home.

--------------------------------------------

Back at the basement, the trio unloaded the tiny bank.

"Uh, Warren?" asked Andrew as he opened the back of the van, "You know that money you shot?"

"Yeah?" he responded.

"It's bigger," he said.

Warren ran forward and saw that Andrew was telling the truth. The money had nearly doubled from it's tiny size and actually seemed to still, though very very slowly, be growing.

"This is fantastic," beamed Warren.

"That we don't need to recharge?" said Andrew, "We might as well. It's gonna take forever for it get to it's full size."

"No," smiled Warren. "The gun was still working. And you shot the slayer."

It took a moment, but the same smile grew on Jonathan's face.

"It looks like that's one small problem out of the way," Warren grinned before the smile stopped, "You did remember to turn the gun back to shrink, right?"
11521.title: Shrinkings...

115212.content:
Buffy groaned as she stirred into consciousness. It had been a quiet night, outside of running into the three idiots and she had made it back in time to get a decent amount of sleep in. It still didn't mean that she wanted to wake up, though and didn't even notice, her eyes barely open, that the world had changed overnight.

Pulling off the covers, Buffy blindly moved into a sitting position on the edge of the bed, stretched her arms out, and yawned. At that very moment, she realized that three things weren't right. Her feet, which usually touched the ground, were dangling in the air over the side of the bed. Her arms, fully outstretched, were still contained inside her yummy sushi pajamas. Her yawn, which she had intended to have some degree of force, was a higher-pitch that almost made her jump, thinking it was made by something else.

She lept to her feet and her pajama pants slid down and bunched at her feet as her enormous pajama top took the role of concealing as far down as beneath her knees. Horrified, she ran to the bathroom and had to climb on a box to see herself in the mirror.

She was relieved to see that she was, indeed, still herself. She had been transformed before and didn't much care for it. She looked down and her body and then back into the mirror. By her estimate, she was now no more than four feet tall. What had happened? Her mind raced as she considered her next move...
115212.title: Smaller Slayer

12.content:
In a large high-rise in the center of Los Angelas, California, is the Wolfram and Hart building. Wolfram and Hart are a hugely successful law firm to the public, but in secret they are in fact an evil multi-dimensional successful law firm. At least, they were. That was before thier new CEO took over.

Angel was a rare case, a Vampire with a Soul.
