For years he had been working to help the helpless with his allies; The former watcher and demon expert Wesley Wyndham-Price, African American Demon Hunter Gunn(who has recently been turned into a lawyer with considerable skill), The flamboyant empath demon Lorne and super-genius(not to mention beautiful) physiscist Fred. Now they all together ran the evil law firm and were trying to change things from the inside, while dealing with another Vampire with Soul, Spike, who now believes he is a champion of the people in Angels' stead.

In this chapter, we'll do things a little different. This time, choose your GTS!
12.title: Itty Bitty Vampire with a Soul

121.content: You're on your way to Fred's lab downstairs. Which manly Demon Figher are you?
121.title: Pick a Demon Fighter

1212.content:
Being one the good guys was never supposed to suck this much.

Here you were, a hero- you sacrficed yourself to seal up the Sunnydale Hellmouth, you burned up like the fourth of july, you saved the world. Then, not more than a month or so later, you're brought back to life-well, unlife- and you're incorporeal. And stuck with HIM.

Angel. The Other Vampire with a Soul. And Buffy's ex-lover. He was supposed to be a hero, too, but now he runs Wolfram and Hart. Demon Incorporated. How confusing. How bloody well irritatin' it is, too.

You ghosted through a wall, seeing Fred examining something closely. She was a little cutey, this one...and she was the only one who was willin' to help you. She had long brown hair, a small and fragile build. Little flat up front, but she still had big brown eyes...adorable little thing. Smart, too, a veritable genius. "How're yeh, Pet?" You ask, swaggering in, your ghostly black duster swishing around you.

"Oh, Spike, Hi! I was just about you call you down here, I think I have a new theory about how to re-corporealise you."

"Bloody lovely, another one, eh?" You asked, tilting your head. She smiled wryly and shook her head.

"Maybe you're liking being unable to interact with the physical world?" Fred asked. You reluctantly nodded and smirked at her.

"Right, then. What do I do?" You ask.

"Great! Now you, my little guinea pig, go stand over on that X made of electrical tape, and I will point this ray gun at you, and it should re-callibrate your molecules and use your own mystical energies to solidify and cause..."

"Okay, Okay, Pet...I'm standin'." You say, cutting her ramble short. She smiles apologetically and nods, sliding her glasses up her nose. You stand where you are, arms at your sides helplessly. Another ray gun or light show to toast your ghostly bottom. She picks up the gun, which is actually more of a big square box with buttons on it, and points it at you. "Is this likely to hurt?" You asked. Fred shakes her head.

"I don't think so. Better brace yourself. Y'know, just in case." Fred says. You nod and stand still, and light envelopes you.

It takes a second, and then the light fades. You're still a little disoriented, and you stumble forward and bump into something big and hard. Wait a minute...bump into something? It worked! You're real again! "Fred! It worked!" you exclaim, and then your vision clears, and you see nothing but a wall. "Fred? Where are you? Oh, bloody hell, not another hell dimension....?" You say, spinning around. The wall you bumped into is like leather, and black. You walk up to it and find it goes into a tip that stops at your head. Above it is a flesh colored plane that extends up to...a white lab coat? A dark skirt underneath? You look up to see Fred's face, high above.

You're corporeal, all right. Corporeal and bloody tiny. How's that for irony?
1212.title: She blinded me with science

choices: Have fun with this size a bit and "explore"
Get Fred's attention and see if she can help
12122.content: "Spike? Spike? Did it work or are you still incorporeal?" Spike looks up and sees that she is still standing there not knowing what just happened. "Well, I'm in a bloody pickle, aren't I" Spike says as he examines the giant girl in front of him. "Hey Genius! Down here!" Spike yells up to Fred, but she doesn't hear him seeing how he's at least an inch and a half tall. "It didn't work and now he disappeared again, well I hope he's alright where ever he is." She then moves her foot that was next to Spike punting him across the room, into her office. "Bloody Hell! Ow! Well I can still feel pain, but it's odd I didn't get any bruises from that?" He was so intrigued with how he survived that he didn't even notice Fred come into her office mumbling to herself. Then a shadow appears over Spike and he finally comes back down to earth, he looks up to find Fred's boot come crashing down on him, pinning him to the floor. "Oh bloody hell, what in the hell is happening?! I'm not dead!" Fred then lifts her foot unbeknown to her that she just stepped on Spike. She just walks on to her desk leaving Spike pondering something. "I'm bloody Invincible! I'm a superhero! I think I might have a little bit more fun with this and have a bite if I wasn't a bloody mosquito! Well might as well try and get some help. Or maybe I can stay like this for a bit and have a little fun with it?" Spike pondered each way he should go and he decides to go...
12122.title: Fred doesn't see Spike

Spike started walking towards Fred with a perky grin on his face. He gets to her desk after what seemed like an eternity only to find her deeply engrossed in her work. "Well, I'm glad that she's wearing the boots, I don't want no bloody foot sweat to deal with! That would be an unpleasant experience and wouldn't give my jollies the thing they need." He made it to her skirt now he could either explore the cave of wonders and get the treasure or climb some more and get to jiggle mountain and enjoy some of that...
121221.title: Have fun with this size a bit and "explore&...

choices: knelt down in front of her desk to get a better look
122.content:
(A little time travel involved. It'll be obvious to which season shortly).
Angel was brooding. Not that it was unusual for him to be brooding. Truthfully, it was almost his registered trademark to be constantly brooding. Right now, he was brooding about Doyle, the Irishman who was half-demon and all dead.
Angel had been having dreams about Doyle, watching Doyle sacrificing himself again and again to save the shipload of half-demon refugees.
Angel always woke up feeling powerless. And broody. Broodingly powerless. Here he was, he said out loud in his empty office, head of a branch of one of most powerful interdimensional organizations in existence, and still his past haunted him, with absolutely nothing he could do about it but brood.
A voice in the middle of the air replied, "Oh, I wouldn't say that."
Angel had always dealt with The Powers That Be. He was about to have a run in with The Powers That Occasionally Gave A Damn If They Thought It Might Be Good For A Cheap Laugh. Angel found himself being sucked into the darkness and emerging...

In his old offices. Angel looked around and immediately knew when he was as well. Doyle was standing with his back to him reading a file. Doyle was alive. And facing the appearing Angel was Cordelia. Cordelia with her long brunette hair, not that freakish short blondish something or other colour.
Another thing was different. Cordelia was huge! Or looking around the office, Angel changed his mind. He was small! He was standing on Cordelia's receptionist desk with a height of six inches!
Cordelia's eyes widened open she saw her shrunken boss. She asked in a tenative voice, "Angel?" She then
122.title: Shrinking in the past

1221.content:
As Cordelia reached down to pick Angel up, he instinctively cringed. He needn't have bothered. He was only a trigger. The Powers Looking For Cheap Laughs had used all of their power to shrink him and send him back into time to get even more power. The power to grant Doyle three subconscious wishes. The Practical Joking Powers thought the saying "Be careful what you wish for. You just might get it." was the funniest punchline in existence.
As soon as Cordelia touched Angel, Doyle straightened up, feeling like a bolt of lightning had just shot through him. The Powers That Thought Fake Vomit Was One Of Humanity's Greatest Accomplishments determined his three wishes and started granting them:

1) Doyle occasionally wished Angel was out of the way so he would have a better shot at Cordelia (the Joking Powers granted this by shooting back shrunken future Angel to his own time. Whether this created an alternate timeline didn't matter to them. Present day full-sized Angel they didn't touch),

2) Doyle wished that he were fully human so that he would have a better shot with Cordelia (the Joking Powers That Chortle purged his demon side, making Doyle fully human, and incidentally, erasing the memory of him from every demon he owed money to. They didn't touch his visionary powers, though. The Joking Powers never rocked the boat of their older 'sibling', the Powers That Be), and

3) Doyle often wished he wasn't so short, at least in relation to Cordelia. The Joking Powers had real fun with this. As soon as Cordelia touched shrunken future Angel he vanished and she took his place.

River stopped and looked at Mal with a stern, upset look. "I know what happened to you. You got under my feet and you still haven't told me why."

"I couldn't get under your feet if I wasn't shrunk!"

"People don't shrink."

"You're holdin me in your hand arn't ya?"

"Yes"

"Well!?"

"I said yes."

"How many people can you normally put in your hand"

"None."

"Well there you go."

"But people don't shrink."

"Just take me to Zoe."

River stares at Mal a moment then says matter-of-factly. "Mabye you're not a person."

Mal is worried again. "What?"

"People don't shrink. People don't fit in hands. And people don't get under other peoples feet." Her eyes narrowed on him at that point. "You are in my hand. You keep saying you shrunk."

"I did!" Mal Interrupted.

River continued without a pause but with emphasis increasing on every following word "And you were under my foot." Her grip seemed to change to a more natural and less careful grip. "That means you can't be a person."

"Just take me to Zoe."

"No, you're not a person. I don't have to listen to your shouting," River said matter-of-factly as she continued down the corridor.

"I'm still the captain here!" Mal shouted, trying to find any way to get her to see some kind of reason.

"Only people can be captains." River looked at him smugly and condescendingly as if he was being silly for suggesting it.

You seem to be meat based, so you are a good source of protein. And you wanted to see Zoe because Wash always complains about her not cooking." River smiled at her deductive abilities.

1432122111121.title: food that doesn't agree with you

River licks her lips at the thought of eating the little captain. "I've never had food as interesting and exciting as you. It normally just sits there."

Mal starts screaming for help and River puts her thumb over his mouth. "Stop being so noisy. Food should be quiet. And you should be glad. Food is supposed to be eaten. Your existence would be pointless otherwise." River kept her thumb on his mouth until she could find some cloth and scissors to make a small gag.

She set Mal down on the counter and tied the gag over his muffled screams. River smiled. "Now I can enjoy my meal in peace."

River licks her lips one more time and lifts Mal toward them and opens her mouth wide.

Mal panics as he approaches River's gaping mouth face first. He twists and turns and fights her grip.

He watches her lips pass, then her teeth. It all seemed so surreal.

Dispite his constant struggling, River was finally able to push him into her mouth. He fit perfectly. He continued to punch and kick inside her mouth.

River found the taste somewhat strange but rather enjoyed the struggle between the small captain and her tongue. She savored the struggle for a few minutes.

Mal tried everything he could to get River to open her mouth, but had no luck. He was however able to get the gag off of himself once he was inside the mouth and was able to use it to hang on to one of her teeth. But her tongue constantly threatened to pull him away.

Since her food was starting to stay in one place she decided to try to swallow. Mal was barely able to keep his grip and stay in the mouth. He was pulled back long enough to trigger a gag reflex which caused River to cough him out onto the counter.

Once River is finished coughing she glares at Mal.
14321221111212.title: my food is problematic

143212211112121.content:
River glared down the troublesome food. "It doesn't understand what it is," she said plainly. "Grind it. Make it pliable. Help it to be what it is." She reached out and again grasped the food with her slender fingers. It was still now, hardly moving at all. River licked her lips again as she anticipated the rush of sensations that eating always brought her.

The food struggled less this time. Perhaps it had finally accepted its role. Regardless, she didn't want to choke again so she'd make sure it went to her belly in smaller portions this time. She lifted the food up above her head and began to lower it into her mouth. Her teeth clamped down on the first part of food that dangled down to her.

She felt the food begin to react as she started to pull it away from her clenched jaws. After some slight resistance, and some noise from the food, a rip signified that she'd been successful. She could already feel part of the food in her mouth. Casually, she began to chew.

* * * * *

"What in the sphincter of hell are you doing?!" Mal screamed at River. He'd been knocked unconscious by the impact with the counter. Fortunately, he'd woken up before he'd been eaten by the crazy, little hou zi de pi gu who's fingers he even now dangled from. Unfortunately, he'd woken up too late to say the same about his favorite brown coat. He rarely wore it while aboard ship; but was glad he had in this instance.

He'd been held upside down by his ankles and the tail of his coat had fallen up and past his head. He realized that, had it not been for the coat, it probably would have been his head that River had chosen to chomp!

A loud 'gulp' signaled the end of River's bite of Mal coat. Her tongue briefly appeared long enough to glide across her lips before disappearing back into her mouth.

"Unique taste," she said, mostly to herself, "mostly protein." Her eyes briefly locked onto his as she continued, "Don't like the consistency. Too chewy." Her tone was very serious and for a brief but surreally ridiculous moment, Mal felt as if she were scolding him for being tough to chew!

"Well I can't claim to be to remorsefulsum about that darlin," he called to her, trying to cram as much calm authority into his tone as possible, "How bout you go ahead and put me down now, dong le ma"?

River's response was, to Mal's surprise, a light giggle as if she'd been truly tickled by his suggestion. "But I'm not done eating you." And again her face turned stern as she continued, "You shouldn't waste food."

"But I'm not food!" Mal yelled as he was hoisted but above her head for a second bite.

"Then why am I eating you?" she asked, her face showing brief concern.

"You shouldn't!" Mal snapped back! Hadn't he already had one of these conversations with her?! If he ever got out of this he was going to have a long talk with her brother about keeping her in her room. As her mouth opened again and he began to lower towards it; the thought of spacing her completely suddenly didn't seem so bad either.

Like lightening, Mal was in motion, in an instant he'd shucked off the rest of his jacket and with a great heave, had chucked it into the back of River's mouth which closed automatically upon registering the new bite.

As loud, wet chewing sounds began to emanate from River's mouth, Mal blew out a breath in momentary relief. He was gonna have to come up with a daring plan and quick if he was going to esc--

GULP!

His eyes widened in shock! She'd eaten that bite much faster than the first; and he was fresh out of coats to sacrifice to her!

"Consistisancy is still unpleasant," River began again, "but easily swallowed in smaller portions." Her eyes briefly played over him, sizing him up. "Portion is small enough," she concluded.

"Shi-wha? No no n--" his protests were cut off as his head and chest easily passed her lips and landed on the back of her tongue. He'd be a son-of-a-bitch if he was gonna go down without a fight though! Mal began to struggle in River's mouth even as she released his ankles. His legs still dangled out past her lips so he tried to use that as purchase to gain some sort of advantage.

River, on the other hand, had other ideas. This food was just another puzzle to solve; even as she enjoyed the taste as it squirming on her tongue.

In her mouth, Mal was growing increasingly panicked. It was like she was reading his mind. Everywhere he tried to turn, the tongue was there first. He tried to push off the teeth, the tongue batted his arm away. He tried to turn himself around and the tip of her tongue greeted his face and pushed him back towards her throat, which loomed larger and larger.

Finally, Mal went for his gun. He hadn't forgotten it; instead he'd kept it as a last resort. He didn't want to kill River, but he didn't want her to kill him either. With a practiced ease he yanked it from it's holster at his hip. As he swung it around in front of him, however, the tongue again intervened, batting the gun effortlessly from his grip.

In horror, Mal watched his service pistol skid over the back of River's tongue before it slid into the gaping abyss of River's throat which clamped shut as she swallowed her metallic treat. When the throat opened again, Mal realized he was next.

* * * * *

Zoe entered the dimmed kitchen, intending to continue right through towards her bunk. "River," she nodded towards the young girl in greeting.

River, leaning against one of the counter tops, didn't reply. It took Zoe a moment longer, in the dimmed lighting, to realize that River had her mouth full of something.

Zoe was about to continue on, but something stopped her. Years on the battlefield had taught her to trust her instincts and right now they were telling her that something was very wrong.

Looking more carefully at River, the only thing she could describe as 'off', more-so than usual, were the two tips of something still sticking out past her lips. As Serenity's XO, Zoe was expected to know almost everything about Serenity; including what was stocked in the galley. The more she looked, the less she was able to place the item River was even now starting to push into her throat.

"River," she said finally, "what are you eating?"

River's eyes wandered over to Zoe as if noticing her for the first time. To answer, she has to empty her mouth. She can spit it out or swallow it.

River, it seems, has decided to...
143212211112121.title: Chomp!

1432122111121212.content:
Zoe watched River’s slender throat work furiously to swallow the mouthful of whatever she’d been eating. A part of her was tempted to force River to spit it out but that wasn’t really her job. Instead, she watched with a combination of wonder and revulsion as that same slender neck distended to accept the oversized bite. It was fascinating to watch as her powerful neck muscles dragged the squirming bite deeper and deeper into the tiny girl before it disappeared completely. Wait, squirming? Must have been a trick of the light.

“Done,” River gasped as she took a breath and opened her mouth as wide as possible to show Zoe that it was empty.

“Yes, I see that,” Zoe said, all business again as she found herself looking at the glistening pink interior of River’s mouth and throat. “But what ‘were’ you eating?”

River glanced down at her now empty hands as if confused at the question. “The Captain,” she said at last.

“The Captain gave you something?” Zoe pressed. She was growing more and more irritated at having to pull teeth to get an answer. At this point it didn’t matter if the girl had been eating the floor plating so long as Zoe could get some shut-eye. “How did it taste?” Zoe called over her shoulder as she turned from River and walked toward her bunk.

Behind her, River smiled brilliantly. “Yummy.”

---------------------------------------------------------

Screaming the entire way, a fleshy valve opened ahead of him and Mal dropped awkwardly into the hot, dark sack of River Tam’s stomach. Immediately he was covered in whatever frothing juices was sitting in the bottom of the girl’s stomach. He struggled back to his feet, spitting out whatever fluid had gotten into his mouth.

“Te me da,” Mal seethed angrily as he bent down and began searching blindly for his gun. It seemed to have vanished however, because all he found in the darkness was more slimy, wrinkled flesh. “River,” he called up to the equally wrinkled ceiling, “damn it girl. Spit me out!” Not exactly the type of sentence he could have foreseen needing to use, but the verse seemed to do that sometimes.

He listened, trying to detect anything beyond the near constant gurgling and thumping coming from River’s body.

“Yummy,” he heard his ingestor moan.

No no no no no. “River,” he called again as loudly as he could as she sloshed through the soupy mix at his feet. Finally he ran almost face first into her stomach wall and began beating his fists against the slimy surface. “River, get your brother! Tell him—“

-------------------------------------------------------

“—what’s happening,” River mouthed soundlessly, unsure why that thought had occurred to her. The fluttering behind her belly button was beginning to make her feel strange. Strange, but not bad. She’d felt that way a number of times, usually when her thoughts had gotten mixed up with Zoe and Wash’s, or Inara’s.

It was a… a happy expectation. Like a rubber band was slowly tightening behind her navel that would feel sooo good when it finally released.

She pressed her delicate fingers against her stomach, and gasped slightly as the fluttering intensified against her fingertips.

“Still food,” she muttered to herself, “broken down like apple bits. But it knows it’s food now and it panics.” She stroked her tummy lovingly, “sshhhh, hush baby, mommy’s here.” She gasped again as the fluttering intensified still further, as if someone were gently tickling her insides.

That thought immediately brought her up short: somebody toying with her insides. They were her insides and it wasn’t right to meddle! Immediately flashes of cold medical rooms and strange cutting tools began to intrude on her pleasant feelings. Somewhere distantly she realized that this usually ended with her brother apologizing after she’d destroyed something else but this time was different. The tickling, pleasant and loving, served as a kind of lifeline keeping her from descending further. She focused letting the darkness pass by her. Finally, she opened her eyes and she was on the Serenity. The strange doctors and their horrible machines were gone.

A radiant smile spread across her face. The sun had come again and it was because of her strange food. Her wonderful strange food. Soon it would become a part of her and the doctors would quit torturing her when she closed her eyes. Thrilled, she rushed off to tell her brother.

--------------------------------------------------------------

“Simon,” a familiar voice whispered urgently. A momentary pause followed by the same voice, “Simon!” Groggily, Simon turned his head till his sister’s smiling face swam into view.

“Mhn…River?” he asked thickly, “Wha…. What the matter?”

“Feel,” River breathed excitedly as she grabbed one of his hands and pressed it against her bare stomach. “We’re pregnant.”

“Wha?!” Immediately Simon was wide awake and stumbling as he tried to jump out of bed but ended up tangled in his sheets. “Wha? Who? I mean…” He was on the edge of panic but River had already broken into a fit of giggles.

“You believed her,” River scolded happily as she rubbed her tummy happily, “Made a face,” she concluded.

“River,” he began angrily. Being woken in the middle of the night for her goofy jokes was not exactly a behavior that he wanted to reinforce, but he couldn’t maintain it as he watched River giggled happily. “You are such a brat,” he concluded at last with a grin slowly growing on his own face.

He turned to climb back into bed, certain that he’d never actually fall back to sleep after that scare but determined to try anyway.

“No,” River whined as she pulled his hand back to her exposed midriff. Suppressing a yawn, Simon again pressed his palm against his sister’s soft skin. He wasn’t sure what he was supposed to feel besides her stomach working away on a meal but he wasn’t feeling it.

“I don’t understand River,” he said gently as he looked up into her eyes. “What are you feeling?”

River’s smile drooped as she seemed to consider her question. “Increased hear rate. Increased blood flow to labia minora. Increa—“

“Your horny?!” Simon blurted, spitting out a sip of water he had been taking as River had spoken, “I… I mean, you’re… aroused?” He dropped his voice as he said aroused on the off chance that somebody was just outside his thin sliding door.

The same radiant smile returned in an instant to River’s face as she nodded. “Affirmative,” she sighed.

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Geeze! How could people like that have won the war?! Twice Mal had lost his footing when the stomach wall he had been punching had suddenly pressed in towards him, apparently because of Simon’s hand. Twice Mal and jumped right back to his feet to hammer as hard as he could against that same hand. And now, what did this fancy doctor with all his schoolin decide after his obviously thorough examination?!

That his crazy sister was horny!

“No!” he hollered up at the dark ceiling to his flesh chamber, “tell him I’m trapped in here! Tell him to get me the ai-yah tyen-ah out of here!” He could just make out the Doctor stuttering madly as he tried to deal with his apparently amorous sister who continued to giggle happily.

Finally, River opened her mouth…

14321221111212121.title: I swallowed the Captain.

14321221211.title: A choice

143212212111.content:
River had become firmly convinced that the miniature Captain Reynolds was actually a shoe insole, and nothing he said had managed to convince her otherwise. If he wasn't a shoe insole, then why had he been under her feet? He had to be.

But River's mind was extremely powerful, and holding such a fervent belief in something was especially dangerous, because she had the power to alter things. So, by believing Malcom Reynolds was a talking insole, he actually literally became a talking shoe insole. Anyone who looked on him now would no longer see him as a human, but as something to be give comfort to feet.

River was able to read minds and knew that no one on the ship worked harder or was in better need of a comfy insole than Kaylee, so she made her was undetected into Kaylee's engine room. The bright cheery woman was laying in her hammock listening to music and didn't notice her enter. Her boots were laying on the floor next to her.

River crept over to the boots and slipped the former captain deep into one of them until the insole was correctly in place. Then she left to go do other crazy things around the ship...

Meanwhile, Kaylee laid there in her hammock enjoying the music and relaxing. It felt good to get out of those stuffy boots once in awhile... But before long a strange noise coming from the engine broke her rest. "Oh no! That power coupler is going at it again!" She swung around and reached for her boots.

Mal cried out to Kaylee to help him, but she couldn't hear him over the engine and the music. Without knowing he was there, she soon stuffed her sock covered foot into the boot and pressed against him. Then she went to work on the engine...

Meanwhile, Mal was finding it hard to breath inside his dark musty prison. For the moment, Kaylee's foot smelled fresh and clean, but this was sure to change as the day went on and she began to sweat. But even now, Mal could feel her full weight pressing down on his entire body and squishing him as if he were made of foam.

For her part, Kaylee was as cheerful and optimistic as ever. Her day had been a good one, and for some reason one of her boots felt extra comfortable today... Later on when she took the boots off...

Just then, Zoe lifted up the boot and...
